page.title: 03General Information
page.content: This 12 Km block is wholly owned by the{Trustees of the Chatsworth {Settlement,}and the house which is called{Chatsworth House}dominates the way of life of all who live here. The House has had many alterations in its life and currently there are some 175 rooms. It is a very attractive building both inside and out and is worthy of its' nickname {"The Palace of the Peak."}It is the home of the Duke and Duchess of Devonshire and is situated at 400 feet above sea level just to the east of the River Derwent. This river itself runs roughly north and south dissecting the area in two. Behind the House to the east is a double escarpment with a plateau at 800 feet, the final escarpment reaching an open moor at 1000 feet. (continued on page 4)
